Yes! the frequency and duration of the drills may depend on your personal fitness level, goals, and other factors. However, here are some general guidelines that you can follow:

1. For cardio exercises like full-court sprints, suicide drills, and 17s, aim to do them two to three times per week, with at least one day of recovery in between. Starting with three sets of each drill and gradually increasing the number of sets as you get fitter.

2. For defensive slide drills, aim to do them at least two to three times a week.

3. For plyometric exercises like jump squats, box jumps, and lateral hops, aim to do two to three sessions a week, each consisting of three to four sets of each exercise.

4. For circuit training, you can do it twice a week, with at least one day of recovery in between.

5. For playing extended periods, you can incorporate it into your regular basketball training sessions, gradually increasing the length of time you spend on the court.

Remember, proper recovery is essential to avoiding injury and improving your overall endurance. Make sure to rest for at least one day in between the drills and avoid overdoing any drill or exercise. Consult with your coach or a qualified fitness trainer if you need a personalized training plan or if you have any concerns.
